channel.title: Replacing usb connector with something more robust
channel.description:
So I hate the micro usb connector on the Axoloti.
I would ideally replace it with the usb type b connector.
Has anyone explored this? Micro usb plugs and jacks seem to loose connectivity easily leaving me frustrated in my small studio or when I travel.
I havent looked for any jacks with a similar foot pribt. Im also open to the idea of addibg a whole other usb jack to a set of io pins if that could be done.
Also, If the boards get a revision: please use usb type b or AT LEAST type c.
Thoughts?
Cheers
Jordan

item.title: Replacing usb connector with something more robust
item.dc:creator: @Ersatzplanet James Husted
item.description:
@Ersatzplanet wrote:

I don't see any problems with using a different connector with the same number of connections as the Micro-USB connector. You just have to match pin-for-pin and hand wire the connector since the spacing will never match. The problems with some connectors is that they are specified for different current delivery. There may be a problem with the type-c connectors which are designed to do the job of both a USB-A and USB-B connector so using one on the Axo would be replacing both of the USB connectors.
